subject: Philosophy
title: The Brain in a Vat
description: A quick, practical guide to The Brain in a Vat.

hook.text: What if you're a brain floating in a vat, fed electrical signals that simulate reality perfectly?

buildup.text: Hilary Putnam made this thought experiment famous. It's the philosophical ancestor of The Matrix.

discovery.text: If the simulation were perfect, you'd have no way to tell the difference. Every test would confirm the illusion.

twist.text: Putnam argued this scenario is self-defeating: a brain in a vat can't truly refer to real vats or brains.

climax.text: The scenario can't be proven or disproven. It's a permanent itch in the philosophy of knowledge.

punchline.text: You can't prove you're not in the vat right now.

quiz.question: What is the 'brain in a vat' scenario meant to illustrate?
options: We can't be certain our experiences reflect reality
Virtual reality will replace the real world
